title.narrative: IR 3- ACCES AUX SERVICES DE PTME ADAPTES

description.narrative: By the end of 2017, at least 50 per cent of pregnant women have access to Prevention of Mother to Child Transmission of HIV (PMTCT) services adapted to their needs and those of their spouses and 30 per cent of children (girls and boys) infected by HIV in need of Antiretroviral (ARV) treatment are effectively under treatment nationwide., which contributes to Adolescents And Hiv/Aids, Care And Treatment Of Children Affected By Hiv And Aids, Hiv Prevention, Hiv â€“ General, Pmtct And Infant Male Circumcision, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2015, the percentage of mothers, newborns and children effectively using quality high impact interventions in health and nutrition has increased, especially at community level.

mailing-address.narrative: Immeuble des Nations Unies - Koulouba 01 BP 3420 - Ouagadougou 01

related-activity.ref: 4590/A0/04/603 PCR 1. INTERVENTIONS A HAUT IMPACT DE QU

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By the end of 2017, at least 50 per cent of pregnant women have access to PMTCT services adapted to their needs and those of their spouses and 30 per cent of children (girls and boys) infected by HIV in need of ARV treatment are effectively under treatment nationwide.

description.narrative: Good progress was made but unsatisfactory progress for the ARV coverage among children affected by HIV/AIDS. The % of pregnant women tested for HIV has increased, while % of HIV positive pregnant women receiving ART remained stagnant. Through UNICEF's support in adolescent health, 40,539 youths were tested for HIV | Status:Met | As-of Date:30/03/2018

title.narrative: % of expected pregnant women who were tested for HIV and received their results
